translated: The Elders’ Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Jagatidāyaka as the Chief Elder
The Elder Jagatidāyaka’s Birth Story
“Under the tree of the Buddha Dhammadassī,
the offspring of the Bodhi tree,
with a confident and joyful mind,

original: jagatiṁ kārayiṁ ahaṁ.🔽Darito pabbatato vā,🔽rukkhato patito ahaṁ;
analyzed: jagatim kārayim aha  daritaḥ pabbatataḥ vā  rukkhataḥ patitaḥ aha
translated: I made a swing.🔽Whether falling from a cliff or a mountain,🔽or falling from a tree,
I find support when I fall,

original: jagatiyā idaṁ phalaṁ.🔽Na me corā vihesanti,
translated: this is the fruit of the swing.🔽Neither thieves nor robbers harm me,
nor do nobles despise me;
I surpass all my enemies,
this is the fruit of the swing.

analyzed: yam yam yonupapajjāmi  devattam atha mānusa
translated: Whatever womb I enter,🔽whether divine or human,
everywhere I am worshipped,
this is the fruit of the swing.
For eighteen hundred eons,
I made swings;
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving swings.
My defilements are burned away,
all my existences are destroyed;
like an elephant breaking its bonds,
I live without defilements.
How welcome it was for me
in the presence of the Buddha;
The three knowledges have been attained,
the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.
The four discriminations,
and the eight liberations,
The six super-knowledges were realized,
and the Buddha’s instruction was fulfilled.”🔽Thus has it been told.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā jagatidāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Jagatidāyakattherassāpadānaṁ paṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā jagatidāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽jagatidāyaka therassa apadānam
translated: The Elder Jagatidāyaka recited these verses.
